title: Human (monster attribute)
data:
- *For other uses of human, see [human](/wiki/Human "Human").*

**Human** is a [monster attribute](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute") that indicates that a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") should be considered *human*.[\[1\]](#cite_note-M2_HUMAN-1) It has many effects, but most significantly it helps determine whether your actions constitute [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism"), same-race [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"), or [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder").

The human attribute should *not* be confused with the [@](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf") [monster symbol](/wiki/Monster_symbol "Monster symbol"), even though they overlap significantly. For example, [Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop") are human but not @, and elves are @ but not human.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [2 Effect](#Effect)
- [3 Internals](#Internals)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Monsters

The following 71 monsters have the human attribute, M2\_HUMAN:

| K [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)") |                                                                              |                                                                        |                                                                              |                                                                     |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse")                                                          | [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper")                                  | [guard](/wiki/Guard "Guard")                                           | [prisoner](/wiki/Prisoner "Prisoner")                                        | [Oracle (monster)](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)")     |
| [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")                               | [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest")                               | [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier")                                     | [sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant")                                        | [lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant")                         |
| [captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain")                                                    | [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman")                                        | [watch captain](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain")                   | [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")                | [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus")                                  |
| [archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)") | [barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)") | [caveman](/wiki/Caveman_\(player_monster\) "Caveman (player monster)") | [cavewoman](/wiki/Cavewoman_\(player_monster\) "Cavewoman (player monster)") | [healer](/wiki/Healer_\(player_monster\) "Healer (player monster)") |
| [knight](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)")                   | [monk](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)")                | [priest](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)")    | [priestess](/wiki/Priestess_\(player_monster\) "Priestess (player monster)") | [ranger](/wiki/Ranger_\(player_monster\) "Ranger (player monster)") |
| [rogue](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)")                      | [samurai](/wiki/Samurai_\(player_monster\) "Samurai (player monster)")       | [tourist](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)") | [valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)")    | [wizard](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") |
| [Lord Carnarvon](/wiki/Lord_Carnarvon "Lord Carnarvon")                               | [Pelias](/wiki/Pelias "Pelias")                                              | [Shaman Karnov](/wiki/Shaman_Karnov "Shaman Karnov")                   | [Hippocrates](/wiki/Hippocrates "Hippocrates")                               | [King Arthur](/wiki/King_Arthur "King Arthur")                      |
| [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master")                                     | [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest")                               | [Orion](/wiki/Orion "Orion")                                           | [Master of Thieves](/wiki/Master_of_Thieves "Master of Thieves")             | [Lord Sato](/wiki/Lord_Sato "Lord Sato")                            |
| [Twoflower](/wiki/Twoflower "Twoflower")                                              | [Norn](/wiki/Norn "Norn")                                                    | [Neferet the Green](/wiki/Neferet_the_Green "Neferet the Green")       | [Thoth Amon](/wiki/Thoth_Amon "Thoth Amon")                                  | [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen")                      |

| [hunter](/wiki/Hunter "Hunter")                                                       | [thug](/wiki/Thug "Thug")                                                    | [ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja")                                           | [roshi](/wiki/Roshi "Roshi")                                                 | [guide](/wiki/Guide "Guide")                                        |
| [warrior](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior")                                                    | [apprentice](/wiki/Apprentice "Apprentice")                                  |                                                                        |                                                                              |                                                                     |

## Effect

The human attribute is used to determine the following things:

- Whether [eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a monster is [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") for a [human player](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2).
- Whether a [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") is of your own race for a human player[\[3\]](#cite_note-3).
- Whether killing a monster is [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4). Killing humans (and only humans) generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") is murder, no matter what your starting race.
- The outcome of an attempt to [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") a monster - human monsters cannot be tamed[\[5\]](#cite_note-5).
- The monster a randomly generated [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") is for.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Figurines of human monsters are very rarely generated.
- What to give when [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for a figurine - wishing for a human monster gives a random figurine[\[7\]](#cite_note-7).
- What to give when wishing for the [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of [quest guardians](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian")[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
- What responses to use when [chatting](/wiki/Chat "Chat") with other [roles](/wiki/Role "Role")' quest guardians[\[9\]](#cite_note-9) (possibly created by [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")).
- Whether a new form is appropriate when a monster is [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorphing "Polymorphing") [\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
- Whether monsters respect [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") or a [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster") when you are not standing on it - humans do not.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11) As @ do not respect Elbereth at all, this applies to monsters of other classes with the human attribute, only - currently, this means K [Keystone Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop").
- Whether to adjust your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") when a monster is [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12) Genociding human monsters reduces the alignment record of [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") adventurers, and increases that of chaotic ones.
- How [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") address you[\[13\]](#cite_note-13) (cosmetic only).
- Whether a [werecreature](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") is in human or animal form[\[14\]](#cite_note-14).

## Internals

In the source, the human attribute is represented by the macro **M2\_HUMAN**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-M2_HUMAN-1)

## Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the  
earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but  
occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit  
mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often  
resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of  
using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the  
Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.

html:
Human (monster attribute)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For other uses of human, see human.

Human is a monster attribute that indicates that a monster should be considered human.[1] It has many effects, but most significantly it helps determine whether your actions constitute cannibalism, same-race sacrifice, or murder.

The human attribute should not be confused with the @ monster symbol, even though they overlap significantly. For example, Kops are human but not @, and elves are @ but not human.

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Effect
  • 3 Internals
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Monsters

The following 71 monsters have the human attribute, M2_HUMAN:

K Keystone Kop
Keystone Kop Kop Sergeant Kop Lieutenant Kop Kaptain
@ human or elf
human wererat werejackal werewolf doppelganger
nurse shopkeeper guard prisoner Oracle (monster)
aligned priest high priest soldier sergeant lieutenant
captain watchman watch captain Wizard of Yendor Croesus
archeologist barbarian caveman cavewoman healer
knight monk priest priestess ranger
rogue samurai tourist valkyrie wizard
Lord Carnarvon Pelias Shaman Karnov Hippocrates King Arthur
Grand Master Arch Priest Orion Master of Thieves Lord Sato
Twoflower Norn Neferet the Green Thoth Amon Master Kaen
Master Assassin Ashikaga Takauji Dark One student chieftain
neanderthal attendant page abbot acolyte
hunter thug ninja roshi guide
warrior apprentice

Effect

The human attribute is used to determine the following things:

  • Whether eating a monster is cannibalism for a human player[2].
  • Whether a sacrifice is of your own race for a human player[3].
  • Whether killing a monster is murder[4]. Killing humans (and only humans) generated peaceful is murder, no matter what your starting race.
  • The outcome of an attempt to tame a monster - human monsters cannot be tamed[5].
  • The monster a randomly generated figurine is for.[6] Figurines of human monsters are very rarely generated.
  • What to give when wishing for a figurine - wishing for a human monster gives a random figurine[7].
  • What to give when wishing for the corpses of quest guardians[8]
  • What responses to use when chatting with other roles' quest guardians[9] (possibly created by reverse genocide or found in bones).
  • Whether a new form is appropriate when a monster is polymorphing [10]
  • Whether monsters respect Elbereth or a scroll of scare monster when you are not standing on it - humans do not.[11] As @ do not respect Elbereth at all, this applies to monsters of other classes with the human attribute, only - currently, this means K Keystone Kops.
  • Whether to adjust your alignment record when a monster is genocided.[12] Genociding human monsters reduces the alignment record of lawful adventurers, and increases that of chaotic ones.
  • How shopkeepers address you[13] (cosmetic only).
  • Whether a werecreature is in human or animal form[14].

Internals

In the source, the human attribute is represented by the macro M2_HUMAN.[1]

Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the
earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but
occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit
mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often
resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of
using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the
Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.

References

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 monflag.h, line 115 monster attribute M2_HUMAN
  2. ↑ eat.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 442
  3. ↑ pray.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1167
  4. ↑ mon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1855
  5. ↑ dog.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 803
  6. ↑ mkobj.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 507
  7. ↑ objnam.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2567
  8. ↑ objnam.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2560
  9. ↑ sounds.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 439
  10. ↑ mon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2408
  11. ↑ monmove.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 899
  12. ↑ read.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1636
  13. ↑ shk.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2275
